hotels.name: Marina Bay Sands
hotels.desc: Iconic rooftop infinity pool, observation deck, luxury suites
hotels.longDesc: Singapore's most recognizable landmark offers 57-floor views, an iconic rooftop pool, and world-class hospitality blending contemporary luxury with panoramic cityscape.

hotels.name: Raffles Hotel Singapore
hotels.desc: Historic colonial landmark, birthplace of the Singapore Sling
hotels.longDesc: Singapore's most storied hotel since 1887, iconic for traditions like the Singapore Sling at the Long Bar and impeccable colonial-era service and architecture.

hotels.name: Capella Sentosa
hotels.desc: Luxury resort on private island, pristine beaches, spa
hotels.longDesc: A sanctuary of 30 colonial villas on private Sentosa cove, featuring white-sand beaches, Michelin-approved dining, and unparalleled island tranquility within the city.

hotels.name: The Fullerton Hotel Singapore
hotels.desc: Historic waterfront landmark, heritage building, Marina Bay views
hotels.longDesc: Iconic waterfront icon since 1887, this former General Post Office exudes grandeur with stunning Marina Bay vistas and sophisticated colonial-modern interiors.

hotels.name: Six Senses Maxwell
hotels.desc: Boutique luxury in conservation shophouse, rooftop bar, Chinatown
hotels.longDesc: A 5-suite ultra-luxury boutique hotel in a restored Chinatown shophouse, featuring rooftop infinity pool, personalized service, and heritage-meets-modern aesthetic.

hotels.name: The Warehouse Hotel
hotels.desc: Chic industrial warehouse lofts, rooftop pool, club street
hotels.longDesc: Converted waterfront warehouse with oversized lofts, rooftop pool with city views, and an effortlessly cool vibe perfect for design-conscious travelers.

hotels.name: Andaz Singapore
hotels.desc: Design-forward hotel in Orchard, contemporary art, rooftop bar
hotels.longDesc: A vibrant contemporary hotel featuring rotating art installations, rooftop bar views, and a casual-luxury approach ideal for creative travelers.

hotels.name: Hilton Singapore
hotels.desc: Premier business hotel, Orchard location, rooftop pool
hotels.longDesc: Centrally positioned on Orchard Road with a rooftop pool overlooking shopping district, professional service, and convenient access to dining and culture.

hotels.name: Pan Pacific Singapore
hotels.desc: Waterfront location near Marina Bay, 33-floor atrium, service-focused
hotels.longDesc: Elegant waterfront property with a stunning 33-floor atrium, impeccable service, and prime location for exploring Marina Bay's cultural attractions.

hotels.name: Shangri-La Singapore
hotels.desc: Tropical garden setting, Valley Wing, near Botanic Gardens
hotels.longDesc: Set on 15 lush acres near UNESCO Botanic Gardens, this sanctuary offers tropical serenity with the Valley Wing's ultra-luxury villas and impeccable service.

hotels.name: National Gallery Hotel Experience
hotels.desc: Art deco design, premium Marina Bay location, cultural access
hotels.longDesc: Located within the National Gallery complex, this distinctive property combines art-focused design with Marina Bay vistas and direct access to world-class exhibitions.

hotels.name: Mandarin Oriental Singapore
hotels.desc: Elegant Marina Bay hotel, afternoon tea tradition, attentive service
hotels.longDesc: A sanctuary of understated elegance on Marina Bay, renowned for afternoon tea, sophisticated interiors, and service that anticipates every desire.

hotels.name: St. Regis Singapore
hotels.desc: Ultra-luxury Orchard property, butler service, rooftop restaurant
hotels.longDesc: The epitome of bespoke luxury with personalized butler service, Michelin-starred dining, and sophisticated Orchard positioning for discerning travelers.

hotels.name: InterContinental Singapore
hotels.desc: Waterfront luxury, Marina Bay Sands views, contemporary design
hotels.longDesc: Modern luxury hotel featuring Marina Bay Sands views, contemporary styling, and prime waterfront location for exploring the cultural quarter.

hotels.name: The Scarlet Singapore
hotels.desc: Boutique luxury in Chinatown, red-themed design, intimate suites
hotels.longDesc: An intimate 13-suite luxury hideaway in historic Chinatown, featuring bold red aesthetics, personalized service, and uniquely Singapore character.

hotels.name: Naumi Singapore
hotels.desc: Contemporary boutique, Kampong Glam, design-led interiors
hotels.longDesc: A sleek 42-suite boutique hotel in Kampong Glam with minimalist design, thoughtful amenities, and proximity to Singapore's vibrant cultural neighborhoods.

hotels.name: Hotel Picotin
hotels.desc: Charming shophouse hotel in Chinatown, heritage meets modern
hotels.longDesc: A lovingly restored shophouse hotel preserving Chinatown character while offering contemporary comfort, perfect for cultural immersion in Singapore's heart.

hotels.name: Amara Singapore
hotels.desc: Boutique hotel at Tanjong Pagar, heritage railway station
hotels.longDesc: Set in a sensitively restored heritage railway building, this unique property blends Singapore's railway history with modern comfort and authentic atmosphere.

hotels.name: Coral Island Resort Sentosa
hotels.desc: Family-friendly Sentosa resort, pools, beach access, activities

hotels.name: Meritus Pelangi Beach Resort
hotels.desc: Sentosa beachfront luxury, spa, water sports, tropical gardens
hotels.longDesc: A beachfront sanctuary on Sentosa with lush gardens, championship spa, water sports access, and a slower pace ideal for relaxation-focused holidays.

hotels.name: Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort
hotels.desc: Luxury Sentosa resort, multiple pools, golf course, beachfront
hotels.longDesc: An upscale resort sprawling across Sentosa with multiple pools, championship golf, beachfront luxury, and excellent family and couple amenities.

hotels.name: The Landmark Hotel
hotels.desc: Business-focused Orchard hotel, rooftop dining, meeting spaces
hotels.longDesc: A well-designed Orchard hotel balancing business functionality with excellent rooftop dining, convenient shopping access, and professional service standards.

hotels.name: Parco Marina Bay
hotels.desc: Luxury Marina Bay location, spa, contemporary design
hotels.longDesc: An architecturally distinctive Marina Bay property offering spa sanctuary, contemporary aesthetics, and world-class access to cultural attractions.

hotels.name: Parkroyal Collection Pickering
hotels.desc: Garden hotel in heritage conservation area, rooftop gardens

hotels.name: W Singapore Sentosa Cove
hotels.desc: Trendy resort on Sentosa, vibrant nightlife, beach pool bars
hotels.longDesc: A lively resort catering to style-conscious travelers with energetic nightlife, beachfront pool bars, and a fun, contemporary approach to island luxury.

hotels.name: The Ritz-Carlton Singapore
hotels.desc: Waterfront mansion hotel, 5-star service, Marina Bay views
hotels.longDesc: An elegant waterfront mansion hotel delivering exemplary service, stunning Marina Bay vistas, and refined luxury for the most discerning travelers.

hotels.name: Sentosa Villa at Capella
hotels.desc: Ultra-luxury private villa retreat on Sentosa island
hotels.longDesc: Capella's most exclusive offering provides ultra-private villa luxury, personalized experiences, and ultimate tropical seclusion within reach of urban attractions.

hotels.name: Four Seasons Singapore
hotels.desc: Premier Orchard luxury hotel, personalized service, fine dining
hotels.longDesc: An iconic luxury destination on Orchard combining impeccable service, award-winning restaurants, and sophisticated design for unforgettable stays.

hotels.name: Hotel Jen Orchardgateway
hotels.desc: Upscale Orchard hotel, integrated mall access, modern design
hotels.longDesc: A sleek contemporary hotel directly integrated with Orchard shopping, combining convenience with design-forward interiors and excellent service standards.

hotels.name: Fortune Hotel Singapore
hotels.desc: Boutique hotel in Little India, colorful heritage surroundings
hotels.longDesc: A charming boutique property capturing Little India's vibrant character, offering authentic neighborhood experience with contemporary comfort and warm hospitality.

hotels.name: Oasia Downtown Singapore
hotels.desc: Rooftop garden hotel in downtown, sustainable design, botanical focus
hotels.longDesc: A botanical-inspired downtown hotel with rooftop gardens, innovative eco-design, and commitment to environmental sustainability wrapped in luxury aesthetics.

hotels.name: Tai-Pan Hotel
hotels.desc: Historic Chinatown hotel, traditional character, heritage feel
hotels.longDesc: A beloved historic Chinatown property preserving Singapore's old-world character while offering sophisticated, reasonably-priced stays in the cultural heart.

hotels.name: Bugis Street Hotel
hotels.desc: Boutique hotel above vibrant Bugis Street, rooftop garden, modern
hotels.longDesc: A contemporary boutique perched above bustling Bugis Street, featuring rooftop garden sanctuary and direct access to Singapore's most vibrant street market.

hotels.name: Crowne Plaza Singapore
hotels.desc: Upscale Kampong Glam location, cultural precinct access
hotels.longDesc: A well-appointed property in the heart of multicultural Kampong Glam, offering easy exploration of Islamic heritage, dining, and neighborhood charm.

hotels.name: Porcelain Hotel
hotels.desc: Quirky design hotel in Chinatown, art-focused, small property
hotels.longDesc: A exceptionally eccentric boutique with art installations, playful design, and intimate 20-room setting creating memorable Chinatown stays with personality.

hotels.name: The Pinnacle@Duxton
hotels.desc: Luxury serviced residences, rooftop skybridge, Marina views

hotels.name: Marina Bay Residences
hotels.desc: Premium Marina Bay serviced apartments, kitchen facilities, luxury
hotels.longDesc: Spacious Marina Bay serviced apartments with full kitchens, premium finishes, and perfect for families or longer stays seeking independence and luxury.

hotels.name: Liberty Hotel Singapore
hotels.desc: Boutique hotel near National Gallery, Bugis junction, modern design
hotels.longDesc: A contemporary boutique offering design-forward interiors, prime location near cultural attractions, and approachable luxury for the discerning traveler.

restaurants.name: Odette
restaurants.desc: 3 Michelin stars, French fine dining, National Gallery location
restaurants.longDesc: Singapore's most prestigious fine dining destination, Odette's 3 Michelin stars showcase exquisite French technique married with bold contemporary innovation.

restaurants.name: Burnt Ends
restaurants.desc: Michelin-starred open-fire barbecue, theatrical kitchen, Chinatown
restaurants.longDesc: A theatrical Michelin-starred temple to fire and meat, featuring an open kitchen where bold charcoal technique transforms premium ingredients into memorable feasts.

restaurants.name: Labyrinth
restaurants.desc: Michelin-starred modern Singaporean, inventive presentations
restaurants.longDesc: A playful Michelin temple celebrating Singapore's multicultural heritage through innovative dishes, theatrical presentations, and unexpected flavor combinations.

restaurants.name: Nouri
restaurants.desc: Michelin-starred innovative, heritage meets contemporary
restaurants.longDesc: One Michelin star recognizing chef Ivan Brehm's reverence for tradition reimaginedâ€”a deeply personal homage to Singapore's culinary evolution and soul.

restaurants.name: Les Amis
restaurants.desc: Michelin-starred French fine dining, classic technique, Orchard
restaurants.longDesc: A Michelin-starred sanctuary of French classical elegance, where traditional technique and impeccable ingredients create timeless fine dining experiences.

restaurants.name: Zen
restaurants.desc: Michelin-starred Japanese, sushi, kaiseki experience
restaurants.longDesc: A serene Michelin-starred temple to Japanese precision, where master sushi chefs craft daily omakase and kaiseki sequences celebrating pristine seafood.

restaurants.name: Born
restaurants.desc: Michelin-starred Japanese kappo, intimate counter dining
restaurants.longDesc: An intimate Japanese kappo experience where the chef guides guests through curated sequences of perfectly executed small plates and pristine preparations.

restaurants.name: Tian Tian Hainanese Chicken Rice
restaurants.desc: Famous hawker institution, legendary poached chicken, queues always
restaurants.longDesc: One of the world's most beloved hawker stalls, famous for silky poached chicken and fragrant riceâ€”arrive early for this iconic Singapore street food.

restaurants.name: Hill Street Tai Hwa Pork Noodle
restaurants.desc: Michelin-starred hawker, prawn and pork mee, legendary queues

restaurants.name: Liao Fan Hong Kong Soya Sauce Chicken
restaurants.desc: Michelin-starred hawker, soy sauce chicken rice, Sheng Siong
restaurants.longDesc: The most casual Michelin-starred establishment, hawker-stall soy sauce chicken beloved by locals and visitors alikeâ€”humble perfection in every bite.

restaurants.name: Hawker Chan
restaurants.desc: World's cheapest Michelin meal, legendary soy sauce chicken
restaurants.longDesc: One Michelin star for soy sauce chicken rice at hawker stall pricesâ€”proof that greatness transcends fine dining surroundings.

restaurants.name: Candlenut
restaurants.desc: Michelin-starred Peranakan, refined ancestral recipes, Dempsey
restaurants.longDesc: One Michelin star celebrating refined Peranakan heritage, where chef Gunawan reimagines ancestral recipes with modern sophistication and passion.

restaurants.name: National Kitchen by Violet Oon

restaurants.longDesc: A celebration of Peranakan heritage in the National Gallery, serving dishes steeped in family tradition and Singapore's multicultural culinary story.

restaurants.name: Jumbo Seafood
restaurants.desc: Famous chili crab, Clarke Quay branch, riverside views
restaurants.longDesc: An institution famous for its signature chili crabâ€”sweet, spicy, and served over Clarke Quay's lively atmosphere perfect for families and celebrations.

restaurants.name: Empress
restaurants.desc: Modern Chinese cuisine, Asian Civilisations Museum, riverside
restaurants.longDesc: Contemporary Chinese dishes in an elegant riverside gallery setting, celebrating regional traditions reimagined with modern technique and artful plating.

restaurants.name: Restaurant Pontianac
restaurants.desc: Traditional Peranakan, curry-house atmosphere, authentic recipes
restaurants.longDesc: A beloved family restaurant serving authentic Peranakan classicsâ€”warming curries, rich sambals, and desserts reflecting Singapore's cultural melting pot.

restaurants.name: Mitzo Restaurant & Bar
restaurants.desc: Cantonese fine dining, dim sum and roasted specialties, elegant
restaurants.longDesc: Refined Cantonese cuisine featuring exquisite dim sum carts, expertly roasted ducks, and sophisticated service in an elegant contemporary setting.

restaurants.name: Napoleon Wine Bistro
restaurants.desc: French bistro, wine bar, heritage shophouse, intimate
restaurants.longDesc: A charming French bistro in a restored conservation shophouse, serving classic cuisine paired with carefully curated wines in an intimate, romantic setting.

restaurants.name: Caveau Bar & Restaurant
restaurants.desc: French wine bar, cocktails, Club Street heritage location
restaurants.longDesc: An upscale cocktail and wine bar in Singapore's heritage quarter, expertly crafted drinks and sophisticated ambiance perfect for evening refinement.

restaurants.name: Smoke & Mirrors
restaurants.desc: Rooftop bar at National Gallery, skyline views, craft cocktails
restaurants.longDesc: Perched above the National Gallery with panoramic city views, this rooftop bar crafts exceptional cocktailsâ€”ideal for sunset drinks and evening enchantment.

restaurants.name: Food Opera
restaurants.desc: Modern hawker atop ION Orchard, elevated casual dining
restaurants.longDesc: A contemporary hawker concept with elegant presentation and city views, elevating iconic street foods into refined but approachable dining experience.

restaurants.name: Satay by the Bay

restaurants.name: Maxwell Food Centre

restaurants.name: Lao Ban Soya Sauce Chicken Rice
restaurants.desc: Legendary soya sauce chicken, Maxwell Food Centre institution
restaurants.longDesc: Located in Maxwell, this iconic stall serves perfectly poached chicken with fragrant soy sauce riceâ€”simple, iconic, and deeply beloved.

restaurants.name: Ah Chew Desserts

restaurants.longDesc: An institution for traditional Chinese desserts, silky tau huay (soybean custard) and cooling cheng tng are perfect respites from tropical heat.

restaurants.name: Tiong Bahru Market Hawkers
restaurants.desc: Historic wet market with hawker stalls, local institution

restaurants.name: Broth by Ah Huat
restaurants.desc: Famous herbal broth and soups, Tiong Bahru market institution
restaurants.longDesc: A beloved stall renowned for restorative herbal broths and healing soupsâ€”traditional Chinese wellness food served with genuine care and expertise.

restaurants.name: Sheng Sheng Beehoon

restaurants.longDesc: Fragrant rice noodles crafted with technique refined over generations, served in Tiong Bahru's charming pre-war market atmosphere.

restaurants.name: Choon Seng Eating House
restaurants.desc: Hawker favorite, chicken rice, Bugis junction, no-frills

restaurants.name: Tekka Centre Indian Stalls

restaurants.name: Springleaf Prata House

restaurants.name: Banana Leaf Apolo

restaurants.name: Sri Krishnan Temple Vegetarian

restaurants.longDesc: Vegetarian Indian cuisine served near the temple with spiritual reverence, showcasing the depth of Indian culinary traditions without meat.

restaurants.name: Katong Laksa

restaurants.longDesc: One of Singapore's most beloved laksa versions, a rich coconut broth fragrant with spices cradling noodlesâ€”soul food at its finest.

restaurants.name: Dragon Well Tea House

restaurants.name: Yum Cha

restaurants.name: Chateraise Patisserie & Cafe

restaurants.longDesc: A beautiful Japanese patisserie crafting elegant cakes, pastries, and coffeeâ€”a sanctuary for those seeking refined sweetness and design-forward aesthetics.

restaurants.name: Tiramisu Hero
restaurants.desc: Famous tiramisu specialties, Italian dessert cafe, Chinatown
restaurants.longDesc: A charming tiramisu specialist offering numerous iterations of the classicâ€”from traditional to contemporary innovations in a cozy Chinatown setting.

restaurants.name: PÃ¢tisserie Chabot
restaurants.desc: French pastry shop, elegant cakes, coffee, Orchard area
restaurants.longDesc: A sophisticated French patisserie crafting elegant pastries and cakes, ideal for gifting or indulging in refined European-style afternoon refinement.

restaurants.name: Forty Hands Coffee

restaurants.longDesc: A minimalist third-wave coffee roastery in Tiong Bahru, where serious coffee enthusiasts gather for precisely crafted, single-origin espresso and filter drinks.

restaurants.name: Oriole Coffee

restaurants.longDesc: A serious coffee establishment focused on sourcing, roasting, and crafting single-origin coffees with care and precision in a minimalist setting.

restaurants.name: Nylon Coffee Roasters
restaurants.desc: Local coffee roastery, single-origin specialties, cafe culture
restaurants.longDesc: Singapore's beloved indie coffee roastery highlighting single-origin beans and brewing excellenceâ€”a hub for the city's passionate coffee community.

restaurants.name: Common Man Coffee Roasters

restaurants.longDesc: A community coffee shop celebrating seasonal single-origins with a cozy neighborhood vibe and deep commitment to coffee quality and sustainability.

restaurants.name: Ramen Yokocho
restaurants.desc: Japanese ramen alley, multiple specialty ramen chefs, Bugis
restaurants.longDesc: A charming ramen alley recreating Japanese street food atmosphere, featuring multiple chefs each perfecting their own regional ramen specialty and broths.

restaurants.name: Tsurumi Ramen
restaurants.desc: Tonkotsu ramen, rich pork broth, Japanese technique, minimal
restaurants.longDesc: A focused ramen shop perfecting tonkotsu broth through patience and techniqueâ€”rich, complex, and deeply satisfying Japanese comfort in every bowl.

restaurants.name: Din Tai Fung
restaurants.desc: Famous xiaolongbao dumplings, Shanghai cuisine, Orchard branch
restaurants.longDesc: An institution famous for delicate soup dumplings with perfectly balanced fillingsâ€”traditional Shanghai technique executed with consistent excellence.

restaurants.name: Tim Ho Wan
restaurants.desc: Casual Michelin dim sum, famous pork buns, accessible pricing
restaurants.longDesc: A Michelin-starred casual dim sum destination famous for shrimp-filled pork buns and quality dim sum at accessible pricesâ€”dim sum democratized.

restaurants.name: Chatterbox Singapore
restaurants.desc: Iconic Peranakan chicken rice, heritage recipe, Mandarin Hotel
restaurants.longDesc: A beloved institution in the Mandarin Hotel serving iconic chicken rice with a Peranakan twistâ€”comfort food elevated through generations of tradition.

restaurants.name: Palais Taj
restaurants.desc: North Indian fine dining, tandoori specialties, elegant setting
restaurants.longDesc: A sophisticated North Indian restaurant showcasing tandoori mastery and aromatic curries in an elegant setting respecting the depth of Indian cuisine.

restaurants.name: Artichoke Restaurant
restaurants.desc: Modern Mediterranean, seasonal ingredients, Marina Bay location
restaurants.longDesc: A thoughtful Mediterranean restaurant celebrating seasonal ingredients and simple preparationsâ€”coastal simplicity with refined technique and care.

restaurants.name: Shinji by Kanesaka
restaurants.desc: Premium sushi restaurant, Japanese omakase, chef-focused
restaurants.longDesc: An intimate sushi counter where the chef guides guests through pristine seasonal fishâ€”Japanese precision and craftsmanship at its finest.

restaurants.name: Xperience Dining at Shangri-La
restaurants.desc: Contemporary Asian cuisine, garden views, luxury dining
restaurants.longDesc: A sophisticated restaurant within the Shangri-La featuring contemporary Asian cuisine with views overlooking lush heritage gardens and quiet elegance.

restaurants.name: Violet Oon Singapore
restaurants.desc: Modern Peranakan, celebrity chef, cultural storytelling

restaurants.name: LongPlay - LP Bar

restaurants.longDesc: A nostalgic vinyl bar in Kampong Glam where classic records spin while expert cocktails flowâ€”a soundtrack to Singapore's creative renaissance.

restaurants.name: Jigger & Pony
restaurants.desc: Award-winning cocktail bar, craft spirits, knowledgeable bartenders
restaurants.longDesc: A serious cocktail bar earning international acclaim for creative house drinks, depth of spirits knowledge, and bartender expertise and hospitality.

restaurants.name: Druggists
restaurants.desc: Craft cocktail bar, apothecary-style, innovative drinks
restaurants.longDesc: A theatrical craft bar with apothecary aesthetic and scientific approachâ€”where bartenders craft innovative cocktails using unusual ingredients and techniques.

experiences.name: Gardens by the Bay
experiences.desc: Iconic Supertrees, conservatories, nightly light shows
experiences.longDesc: A botanical wonderland showcasing 18 Supertrees with evening light shows, immersive conservatories, and the perfect blend of nature and technological innovation.

experiences.name: Marina Bay Sands SkyPark
experiences.desc: 57-floor observation deck, 360-degree views, iconic pool
experiences.longDesc: Singapore's highest vantage point delivers breathtaking 360-degree views of the entire city-stateâ€”an unforgettable perspective of urban and natural landscapes.

experiences.name: Merlion Park
experiences.desc: Singapore's national symbol, iconic statue, waterfront views
experiences.longDesc: The most photographed symbol of Singaporeâ€”a mythical lion-fish guardian welcoming visitors to explore the heritage and energy of Marina Bay.

experiences.name: Singapore Botanic Gardens
experiences.desc: UNESCO heritage site, 160 acres, peaceful gardens and lakes
experiences.longDesc: A UNESCO World Heritage sanctuary spanning 160 acres with manicured gardens, swan lakes, and botanical collectionsâ€”an oasis of tropical serenity.

experiences.name: National Museum Singapore
experiences.desc: Singapore's history and culture, interactive exhibits, museums
experiences.longDesc: Engaging exhibits trace Singapore's transformation from colonial trading post to modern city-state, offering cultural context through interactive storytelling.

experiences.name: National Gallery Singapore
experiences.desc: Southeast Asian art, world-class exhibitions, architectural landmark
experiences.longDesc: Housed in two former government buildings, this gallery showcases Southeast Asian art spanning centuriesâ€”from classical to cutting-edge contemporary works.

experiences.name: ArtScience Museum
experiences.desc: Lotus-shaped building, art-science fusion, interactive exhibits
experiences.longDesc: A distinctive lotus-shaped building housing imaginative exhibits at the intersection of art and scienceâ€”ideal for curious minds of all ages.

experiences.name: Singapore Zoo
experiences.desc: World-class open-concept zoo, wildlife, interactive shows
experiences.longDesc: One of the world's finest zoos featuring open-concept habitats, daily shows, and immersive encounters celebrating biodiversity and conservation.

experiences.name: Night Safari
experiences.desc: Nocturnal wildlife experience, tram ride, unique animal encounters
experiences.longDesc: A revolutionary concept showcasing nocturnal animals in natural habitatsâ€”a thrilling tram journey through tropical darkness revealing night creature behavior.

experiences.name: River Safari
experiences.desc: River-themed wildlife park, boat safari, giant pandas
experiences.longDesc: A water-based wildlife experience featuring river animals and habitats, highlighted by giant pandas and scenic boat safaris through themed zones.

experiences.name: Sentosa Island
experiences.desc: Resort island, beaches, attractions, cable car access
experiences.longDesc: A purpose-built island resort featuring pristine beaches, luxury hotels, restaurants, attractions, and scenic cable car access from the city.

experiences.name: Universal Studios Singapore
experiences.desc: Theme park, movie-themed rides, family attractions, shows
experiences.longDesc: A vibrant theme park with movie-themed lands, thrilling rides, live entertainment, and family-friendly attractions celebrating cinematic storytelling.

experiences.name: S.E.A. Aquarium
experiences.desc: World's largest aquarium, interactive touch pools, marine life
experiences.longDesc: The world's largest aquarium by water volume showcasing over 40,000 marine creaturesâ€”interactive and awe-inspiring encounters with ocean biodiversity.

experiences.name: Sentosa Beaches
experiences.desc: Family-friendly sandy shores, water sports, tropical escape
experiences.longDesc: Three pristine Sentosa beaches with calm waters, rental activities, beachfront dining, and tropical island atmosphere just minutes from the city.

experiences.name: Chinatown Heritage
experiences.desc: Traditional shophouses, street heritage, wet market, temples
experiences.longDesc: A living heritage district where traditional shophouses, temples, and bustling wet markets reveal Singapore's multicultural history and traditions.

experiences.name: Little India
experiences.desc: Cultural enclave, colonial buildings, spice shops, temples
experiences.longDesc: A vibrant cultural enclave bursting with colorful heritage buildings, fragrant spice shops, temples, and authentic Indian restaurants and traditions.

experiences.name: Kampong Glam
experiences.desc: Arab Quarter, Islamic heritage, Sultan Mosque, trendy cafes
experiences.longDesc: Singapore's Arab and Islamic quarter featuring the ornate Sultan Mosque, heritage buildings, boutique shops, and a creative community renaissance.

experiences.name: Joo Chiat & Katong
experiences.desc: Heritage Peranakan neighborhood, colorful shophouses, cuisine
experiences.longDesc: A charming neighborhood of colorful Peranakan shophouses preserving Singapore's heritage while welcoming trendy cafes and artisan discoveries.

experiences.name: Clarke Quay
experiences.desc: Historic waterfront, riverside restaurants, nightlife, ambiance
experiences.longDesc: A vibrant waterfront with restored shophouses, riverside dining, and evening energyâ€”Singapore's living reminder of its merchant trading heritage.

experiences.name: Boat Quay
experiences.desc: Historic shophouses, river views, restaurants, charming streets
experiences.longDesc: Singapore's oldest riverbank district preserving pre-war shophouses, river views, and intimate restaurants along narrow heritage-filled lanes.

experiences.name: Raffles Hotel Singapore
experiences.desc: Historic colonial landmark, afternoon tea, Singapore Sling
experiences.longDesc: An iconic institution since 1887 where visitors experience colonial elegance, the legendary Singapore Sling, and timeless hospitality traditions.

experiences.name: Peranakan Museum
experiences.desc: Peranakan culture, heritage artifacts, cultural storytelling
experiences.longDesc: An intimate museum celebrating Peranakan heritage through intricately displayed artifacts, textiles, and narratives of this rich cultural heritage.

experiences.name: Asian Civilisations Museum
experiences.desc: Asian art and history, multiple civilisations, riverside setting
experiences.longDesc: Exploring civilizations across Asia through art, textiles, and historical artifacts in riverside eleganceâ€”a window into continental heritage and connections.

experiences.name: Singapore History Museum
experiences.desc: Singapore's transformation, interactive stories, modern state
experiences.longDesc: Chronicles Singapore's evolution from fishing village through colonial period to modern city-state via interactive exhibits and compelling historical narratives.

experiences.name: Sri Mariamman Temple
experiences.desc: Historic Hindu temple, ornate gopuram, spiritual sanctuary
experiences.longDesc: Singapore's oldest Hindu temple features an ornately carved gopuram, fragrant incense, and spiritual sanctity welcoming respectful visitors.

experiences.name: Thian Hock Keng Temple
experiences.desc: Historic Chinese temple, intricate carvings, heritage landmark
experiences.longDesc: One of Singapore's oldest Chinese temples showcasing intricate carvings and architecture, spiritually significant and architecturally magnificent.

experiences.name: Sultan Mosque
experiences.desc: Grand Islamic architecture, golden dome, spiritual sanctuary
experiences.longDesc: An architectural masterpiece with golden dome dominating Kampong Glam's skylineâ€”a magnificent testament to Islamic art and community spirituality.

experiences.name: Orchard Road
experiences.desc: Luxury shopping district, malls, restaurants, nightlife
experiences.longDesc: Singapore's premier shopping destination stretches over a mile with world-class malls, fine dining, and designer boutiques amid tropical greenery.

experiences.name: Pulau Ubin
experiences.desc: Island getaway, nature trails, village character, kayaking
experiences.longDesc: An island oasis near the main city preserving village character, mangrove ecosystems, and outdoor adventuresâ€”a rural escape within urban reach.

experiences.name: MacRitchie Reservoir
experiences.desc: Nature reserve, forest trails, reservoir views, urban jungle
experiences.longDesc: An urban nature sanctuary with forest canopy walks, trails, and pristine reservoirâ€”a verdant escape proving Singapore's commitment to green living.

experiences.name: Singapore Flyer
experiences.desc: Giant observation wheel, 165m height, 360-degree views
experiences.longDesc: Southeast Asia's tallest observation wheel rotating 42 times daily offering unparalleled 360-degree views of Marina Bay and urban landscape.

experiences.name: Tiong Bahru Enclave
experiences.desc: Heritage neighborhood, pre-war charm, boutique shops
experiences.longDesc: A pre-war neighborhood preserving 1930s charm with art deco shophouses, quirky cafes, antique shops, and pockets of bohemian creative culture.

experiences.name: Bugis Street Market
experiences.desc: Historic street market, fashion, trinkets, street food
experiences.longDesc: A legendary street market buzzing with fashion vendors, street food stalls, and local characterâ€”a sensory adventure and tourist attraction.

experiences.name: Arab Street Bazaar
experiences.desc: Colorful bazaar, textiles, perfumes, spices, cultural heart
experiences.longDesc: A fragrant, vibrant bazaar reflecting Arab merchant heritage with textiles, perfumes, and spicesâ€”the aromatic heart of Kampong Glam's cultural identity.

experiences.name: Dempsey Hill
experiences.desc: Residential enclave, colonial buildings, boutique shops
experiences.longDesc: A charming colonial-era residential district with thoughtfully restored buildings housing galleries, restaurants, and design boutiquesâ€”understated elegance.

experiences.name: Gillman Barracks
experiences.desc: Former military barracks, art galleries, creative studios
experiences.longDesc: A creative hub housed in converted military barracks featuring contemporary art galleries, artist studios, and innovative cultural programming.

experiences.name: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay
experiences.desc: Performing arts center, architecture icon, cultural programming
experiences.longDesc: An architectural icon dubbed the 'Durian' for its distinctive shell design, hosting world-class performances and cultural programming year-round.

experiences.name: Victoria Concert Hall
experiences.desc: Historic concert venue, Singapore's oldest building, classical music
experiences.longDesc: Singapore's oldest building and premier classical music venue, an architectural gem preserving colonial heritage while hosting contemporary performances.

experiences.name: Chinatown Heritage Centre
experiences.desc: Museum in heritage shophouses, family history, traditions
experiences.longDesc: An immersive museum within restored shophouses revealing Chinatown's historyâ€”cramped living quarters, family traditions, and immigrant heritage.

kidFriendly.name: Singapore Zoo
kidFriendly.desc: World-class zoo, open-concept habitats, interactive shows
kidFriendly.longDesc: One of the world's finest zoos with open-concept exhibits, daily shows, and nature-based learningâ€”engaging and joyful for children of all ages.

kidFriendly.name: Night Safari
kidFriendly.desc: Evening wildlife tram ride, nocturnal animals, unique adventure
kidFriendly.longDesc: A thrilling evening adventure aboard trams through darkened habitatsâ€”an extraordinary way for children to encounter nocturnal wildlife naturally.

kidFriendly.name: River Safari
kidFriendly.desc: River-themed wildlife park, boat safari, giant pandas - kidFriendly
kidFriendly.longDesc: A water-based wildlife park with boat safaris, river habitats, and the beloved giant pandasâ€”engaging and educational for curious young explorers.

kidFriendly.name: Universal Studios Singapore
kidFriendly.desc: Theme park with family-friendly rides, shows, attractions
kidFriendly.longDesc: A vibrant theme park celebrating movies with thrilling rides, live entertainment, and attractions engaging families across age ranges and interests.

kidFriendly.name: S.E.A. Aquarium
kidFriendly.desc: World's largest aquarium, touch pools, marine exploration
kidFriendly.longDesc: The world's largest aquarium with interactive touch pools and mesmerizing exhibitsâ€”a magical underwater journey captivating young and old alike.

kidFriendly.name: Sentosa Island Beaches
kidFriendly.desc: Family beaches, water sports, activities, tropical escape
kidFriendly.longDesc: Three pristine beaches with calm waters, rental activities, and nearby family amenities creating the perfect tropical day-trip for family bonding.

kidFriendly.name: ArtScience Museum
kidFriendly.desc: Interactive art-science exhibits, hands-on learning experiences
kidFriendly.longDesc: Imaginative interactive exhibits where children explore the intersection of art and science through playful, hands-on discovery and creative expression.

kidFriendly.name: Gardens by the Bay
kidFriendly.desc: Supertrees, conservatories, nightly light shows, nature explore
kidFriendly.longDesc: A magical garden with towering Supertrees, family-friendly conservatories, and nightly light showsâ€”a feast for young imaginations and senses.

kidFriendly.name: Singapore Botanic Gardens
kidFriendly.desc: UNESCO gardens, open spaces, playgrounds, peaceful walks
kidFriendly.longDesc: A serene 160-acre sanctuary with open lawns, playground areas, and gentle pathsâ€”ideal for family picnics and nature-based relaxation and exploration.

kidFriendly.name: Singapore Flyer
kidFriendly.desc: Giant observation wheel, slow-rotating pods, panoramic views
kidFriendly.longDesc: Southeast Asia's tallest observation wheel with slow-rotating glass pods providing breathtaking viewsâ€”exciting yet safe for children of all ages.

kidFriendly.name: KidsSTOP at Science Centre Singapore
kidFriendly.desc: Interactive science museum, hands-on learning, STEM exploration
kidFriendly.longDesc: A dedicated children's space within Science Centre featuring interactive STEM exhibits that make learning physics, biology, and innovation joyful and tangible.

kidFriendly.name: Kidzania Singapore
kidFriendly.desc: Indoor edutainment park, role-play activities, career exploration
kidFriendly.longDesc: An indoor city where children aged 4-16 explore careers through immersive role-playâ€”police officer, chef, architectâ€”making learning through play engaging.

kidFriendly.name: Legoland Discovery Centre
kidFriendly.desc: Indoor LEGO attraction, rides, building experiences, creative
kidFriendly.longDesc: A colorful indoor LEGO wonderland with rides, building stations, and 4D cinemaâ€”engaging the builder in every child through hands-on brick creativity.

kidFriendly.name: Adventure Cove Waterpark
kidFriendly.desc: Waterpark with slides, lazy river, splash areas, family fun
kidFriendly.longDesc: A Sentosa waterpark with thrilling slides, gentle lazy river, and splash areasâ€”perfect for cooling off while enjoying tropical water adventures.

kidFriendly.name: Marina Bay Sands SkyPark
kidFriendly.desc: Observation deck, 57-floor views, exciting perspective
kidFriendly.longDesc: An exhilarating high-altitude experience where children marvel at 360-degree views of Singapore from Asia's highest vantage point.

kidFriendly.name: Botany Park Singapore
kidFriendly.desc: Botanical gardens, nature trails, outdoor learning spaces
kidFriendly.longDesc: Sprawling botanical sanctuary with accessible trails, garden areas, and outdoor learning opportunitiesâ€”nature education in a UNESCO-heritage setting.

kidFriendly.name: Cooking classes for kids
kidFriendly.desc: Hands-on culinary experiences, learn to cook Peranakan
kidFriendly.longDesc: Interactive cooking classes where children learn traditional Singapore dishesâ€”hands-on food education combining cultural learning with delicious outcomes.

kidFriendly.name: Singapore History Museum
kidFriendly.desc: Interactive history exhibits, engaging storytelling, time travel
kidFriendly.longDesc: Interactive exhibits transform Singapore's history into engaging narrativesâ€”perfect for curious children to understand the city's remarkable transformation.

kidFriendly.name: National Museum Singapore
kidFriendly.desc: Cultural exhibits, interactive activities, hands-on learning
kidFriendly.longDesc: Engaging interactive exhibits introducing children to Singapore's multicultural heritage through objects, stories, and hands-on discovery activities.

kidFriendly.name: Pulau Ubin Cycling
kidFriendly.desc: Island cycling, forest paths, village exploration, outdoor
kidFriendly.longDesc: Family-friendly cycling adventure on quiet island paths, exploring village character and mangrove ecosystemsâ€”outdoor education and bonding time.

markets.name: Maxwell Food Centre
markets.desc: Legendary hawker center, multiple cuisines, institution
markets.longDesc: One of Singapore's most famous hawker centersâ€”a multi-stall pilgrimage site where generations have queued for icon dishes like Tian Tian chicken rice.

markets.name: Chinatown Heritage Centre Market
markets.desc: Wet market in shophouse heritage, cultural experience, authentic
markets.longDesc: A living museum where traditional wet market hustle happens within heritage shophousesâ€”authentic sensory immersion in Chinatown's merchant past.

markets.name: Tekka Centre Market
markets.desc: Multi-level wet market, Indian vegetables, spice vendors
markets.longDesc: A vibrant multi-level market overwhelming the senses with exotic spices, fresh vegetables, and the rhythmic energy of Singapore's Indian commerce.

markets.name: Tiong Bahru Market
markets.desc: Historic wet market, pre-war charm, hawker stalls
markets.longDesc: A charming pre-war market preserving old-world Singapore character with working wet market vendors and scattered legendary hawker stalls.

markets.name: Bugis Street Market
markets.desc: Historic street market, fashion, trinkets, street food, vibrant
markets.longDesc: A legendary street market buzzing with fashion vendors, local trinkets, and street food stallsâ€”sensory adventure and authentic cultural exploration.

markets.name: Arab Street Bazaar
markets.desc: Colorful bazaar, textiles, perfumes, spices, heritage
markets.longDesc: A fragrant, vibrant bazaar reflecting Arab merchant heritage with exotic textiles, perfumes, spicesâ€”the aromatic heart of Kampong Glam.

markets.name: Hong Kong Street Wet Market
markets.desc: Traditional wet market, fresh produce, fish, local vendors
markets.longDesc: An authentic wet market where locals shop daily for produce, fresh fish, and meatâ€”unfiltered market energy and real neighborhood commerce.

markets.name: Serangoon Road Market
markets.desc: Indian spice market, vegetable vendors, Little India energy
markets.longDesc: A fragrant spice and vegetable market in Little India's heartâ€”where aromas of cumin, coriander, and turmeric create an intoxicating sensory experience.

markets.name: Jalan Besar Fruit & Vegetable Market
markets.desc: Fresh produce market, tropical fruits, local farmers
markets.longDesc: A neighborhood fruit and vegetable market showcasing tropical produce and seasonal local cropsâ€”morning visits reveal neighborhood food culture.

markets.name: Whampoa Market
markets.desc: Community wet market, fresh seafood, local favorite
markets.longDesc: A neighborhood institution where locals gather for fresh seafood and produceâ€”authentic market energy without tourist overlay.

markets.name: Pasir Ris Market
markets.desc: Suburban wet market, neighborhood gathering place
markets.longDesc: A local suburban market reflecting authentic neighborhood commerceâ€”where families shop daily for fresh ingredients and market gossip.

markets.name: Chong Pang Market
markets.desc: Traditional wet market, morning fresh produce, local vendors
markets.longDesc: An early-morning market bustling with vendors and locals seeking the day's freshest produceâ€”authentic neighborhood grocery experience.

markets.name: Far East Plaza Hawker Centre
markets.desc: Modern hawker center, food court, diverse cuisines
markets.longDesc: A contemporary food court within a shopping complex offering diverse hawker cuisinesâ€”modern, air-conditioned hawker experience near Orchard.

markets.name: Clementi Market Hawkers
markets.desc: Neighborhood hawker center, local favorite, casual dining
markets.longDesc: A local hawker center where neighborhood families gather for authentic casual diningâ€”no tourist markup, just genuine local food culture.

markets.name: Laksa and Kueh Stalls
markets.desc: Katong hawker stalls, iconic laksa, local specialties
markets.longDesc: Legendary stalls in Katong area famous for spiced laksa, kueh (desserts), and Peranakan specialtiesâ€”neighborhood food legacy preserved.
